intro: Lagotis kongboensis, commonly known as the Kongbo bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
